note.p: Education: Giessen; MD (1713). St John's College, Oxford; MD (1735)

Career: Practised in Grunberg, Upper Hesse; Town Physician of Giessen; invited to England by William Sherard (FRS 1720) (1721); stayed in Oxford and London with Sherard and at Eltham with his brother, James Sherard (FRS 1706); first Professor of Botany at Oxford (1728) by the bequest of William Sherard; Carl Linnaeus (FRS 1753) visited him at Oxford (1736); died of apoplexy
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; DSB; Foster; DBE
Authority: First Altname from DNB, second from DSB
